page.title: 06THE CARDIFF TIDAL YARD I
page.content:
{RAILWAY FREIGHT YARD IN SPLOTT { THE CARDIFF TIDAL YARD }
NINE OF US WENT ON THIS VISIT .FIRST WE PUT ON BRIGHT ORANGE WAIST COATS AND THEN WE WERE TAKEN OUT TO THE YARD.WE SAW A TRAIN PUSHING WAGGONS UP TO OTHER WAGONS,THIS IS CALLED SHUNTING.A MAN IN A YELLOW COAT WAS HOOKING THE WAGGONS UP AS THEY RAN INTO EACH OTHER,THIS IS CALLED COUPLING.WHEN THE WAGGONS HIT ONE ANOTHER THE BUFFERS HIT ONE ANOTHER AND MADE A TERRIFIC BANGING SOUND.THE WAGGONS WERE LOADED WITH WIRE AND METAL BARS FROM THE LOCAL IRON WORKS.WHEN THE TRAIN WAS PUT TOGETHER IT WAS GOING TO SEVERN JUNCTION WHERE SOME WAGGONS WOULD AGAIN BE SPLIT OFF,SOME GOING TO SCOTLAND,OTHERS TO BIRMINGHAM AMONG OTHER PLACES.WE CLIMBED INTO THE BRAKE WAGGON AND SAW
